ygData.subject: Crawl orders / ServerCache problem
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello all, Where can I get version 1.6, is it possible without using CVS? I m having a very frustrating problem with 1.4.0 on Win2k Advanced Server

Hello all,

Where can I get version 1.6, is it possible without using CVS?

I'm having a very frustrating problem with 1.4.0 on Win2k Advanced 
Server (Unfortunately my Gentoo dev box is on the fritz and I'm in 
the middle of a rapid prototyping contract so I do not have the time 
to get it back up). I have my startup script written as recommended 
with the proper classpath in the proper order. Everything seems to be 
in order except I always get the ServerCache error for any domain or 
ip address I try to crawl. The box is not running anything else and 
is not firewalled. (I thought for a moment that my firewall was 
giving Heritrix a hard time but that seems unlikely, I just wanted to 
get that out of the way before asking for help.)

I am counting on Heritrix to feed a knowledge refinery before the 
weekend. Perhaps there is an issue with my crawl order? Could someone 
post or send me a domain scope crawl order that is known to be 
working? I can fill in the seeds. The order I have uses no pre-fetch-
processors, another post suggested eliminating this part of the chain.

I would like to lend a hand developing, I like the architecture and 
plan to be using it for a few projects but I have to get some crawls 
running first.

Thank you in advance any help will be greatly appreciated,

Brian M. Lima
brianmlima@...
